pages.text: The $(2)Laser Turret$() is a statically-mounted variant of the photonic weapon casing. While completely immobile, it can be used as an autonomous defense system for the engineering-inclined tactician.$(br2)The laser turret will require an external source of power to maintain its internal energy cell at operable levels. To this end, $(3)Forge Energy$() can be injected into the casing from
any face via the appropriate cables.$(br2)Upgrading the casing increases the modifier slot count while retaining any previously-installed components.

pages.title: Basic Laser Turret
pages.text: The most basic model. Features one modifier slot.

pages.title: Advanced Laser Turret
pages.text: A slightly more advanced model. Features two modifier slots.

pages.title: Elite Laser Turret
pages.text: A model designed for the elite tactician. Features three modifier slots.

pages.title: Ultimate Laser Turret
pages.text: The ultimate advancement in photonic defense systems. Features four modifier slots.

pages.title: Control Schemes
pages.text: The laser turret responds to control signals in the form of digital redstone pulses. Each $(l:core/intro)Firing Paradigm$() uses a different control scheme; these will be delineated on the following pages.

pages.title: Semi-Automatic
pages.text: Semi-automatic weapon cores expose the most simple control interface. The turret will fire once on the rising edge of each pulse.

pages.title: Automatic
pages.text: Automatic weapon cores will continuously fire while the input is high. Be wary of overheating.

pages.title: Charge Shot
pages.text: Charge-based weapon cores will charge while the input is high, then release all the stored energy on the falling edge.
